subfields.a: Foreword -- The Arkansas River -- lone wolf of the Rockies -- Water, the miracle of "the Great American Desert" -- Civil War rebels on the Greenhorn -- Penitentes in southeastern Colorado -- La Veta, Col. John M. Francisco's paradise -- Kit Carson put duty to country foremost in his life of adventure -- Uncle Dick Wootton lived through the great transition in Colorado -- Wootton was among first builders of Colorado -- Charles Goodnight blazed first Colorado cattle trails -- Tom Tobin stopped the blood trail of the murderous Espinosas -- White man pushed buffalo and Indian from the Colorado scene -- Reynolds bandit gold still may be buried in Colorado -- Bent County spawns eight other counties -- Lamar was cattleman's last holdout -- Salvation Army founded Amity as colony for underprivileged -- Valley of Purgatoire Oasis for early Spanish explorations -- Walsenburg began as La Plaza De Los Leones -- Miguel A. Otero, founder of La Junta -- George W. Swink made Rocky Ford Cantaloupe famous -- Utes massacred El Pueblo populace Christmas Day, 1854 -- Pueblo Mormon village first Anglo-Saxon settlement in Colorado -- Pueblo schools were early day laboratories of educational plans -- Guggenheims started industrial empire in Colorado -- Colorado Fuel & Iron Corp. -- the industry that is building the West -- Damon Runyon, Colorado's Kipling, spent his boyhood in Pueblo -- Sister Blandina talked Billy the Kid out of murdering Trinidad doctors -- Bat Masterson shot up both sides of law and order -- Fingerprint and postal service trapped Lamar's Fleagle Gang -- World celebrities visit historic Don K Ranch [Dr. Edward Doisy] [Dr. John Bugher] [Baroness Gabriel Barracco] [Pierre Fermin-Ditot] [Raymond Ingram] [Arthur Lotz] [Hugh Rose] [Count von Blumenfield] [Sandford Luftig] -- Ford Frick goes from Walsenburg first base to baseball commissioner -- World beats path to Rocky Ford door of inventor Francis H. Clute -- The solid Muldoon hoax of 1878 -- Coin Harvey was builder of Utopian palaces -- Historic monuments, markers, plaques, memorials and statues -- Origin of names.

Illustrations: Remnants of Bent's Fort -- Col. William W. Bent -- Charles Bent -- Ceran St. Vrain -- Alexander Hicklin -- Mrs. Estefana Bent Hicklin -- Statue of Senator Thomas Benton -- Charles Autobees -- St. Vrain cemetery -- Capt. Charles Deus -- Col. John M. Francisco -- Richens L. Wootton -- The Pueblo Wootton knew -- Col. John M. Chivington -- Battle of Sand Creek -- Hiram S. Holly -- L.Q.C. Lamar -- Casimiro Barela -- James A. McCandless -- Anson Rudd -- Streamliners use Wootton Toll Road -- George M. Ordway -- Oliver H.P. Baxter -- Capt. J.J. Reynolds -- Charles Allen Mine -- John D. Rockefeller, Jr., and W.L.M. King -- Ludlow tent colony -- After the fire at Ludlow -- Damon Runyon -- William Bonney, Billy the Kid -- William Barclay (Bat) Masterson -- Madonna of the Trail -- Monument to Christopher Columbus.
Maps: Mexican land grants in Colorado -- Principal trails in 1840s and 1850s -- Santa Fe Trail.
